supporting_text: The NAP adopts a One Health approach by integrating human health, animal health, and environmental considerations.
The NAP includes specific strategies aimed at improving human health outcomes related to AMR.
The NAP outlines actions specifically directed at addressing AMR in the animal health sector.
The NAP includes strategies that address environmental factors contributing to AMR.
The NAP outlines actions related to agriculture and food security in the context of AMR.
The NAP specifies mechanisms for regular progress reporting on its objectives.
The NAP sets specific, time-bound targets for various actions related to AMR.
The NAP includes quantitative targets for monitoring AMR prevalence and antimicrobial usage.
The NAP outlines budget allocations for implementing its strategies against AMR.
The NAP includes an assessment of future budget needs for various AMR-related activities.
The NAP establishes a multisectoral committee to coordinate AMR efforts.
The NAP includes actions aimed at strengthening the legislative framework for AMR.
The NAP outlines educational initiatives to raise awareness about AMR in various training programs.
The NAP includes strategies for public awareness campaigns to combat AMR.
The NAP emphasizes international collaboration with organizations like WHO and FAO for AMR initiatives.
The NAP includes actions for developing surveillance systems and data collection for AMR monitoring.
The NAP includes strategies to enhance capacity for detecting and reporting new resistance.
The NAP outlines specific prevention strategies including sanitation and infection control measures.
The NAP includes actions to implement international standards for AMR control.
The NAP includes strategies for regulating antibiotic distribution and prescription.
The NAP includes regulations aimed at ensuring the rational use of antibiotics.
The NAP includes actions to participate in international research for new medicines and diagnostics.
